snippet: Across Syria, a country that long prided itself on providing affordable food to its people, efforts to ensure basic sustenance appear to be failing, and millions are going hungry.
abstract: Millions of Syrians face food shortages as both government and rebel groups use siege and starvation as tactic of war; experts warn that if crisis continues into winter, deaths from hunger and illness could begin to dwarf deaths from violence.

byline.contributor: Mohammad Ghannam contributed reporting from Beirut, and an employee of The New York Times from Qudsaya, Syria.

lead_paragraph: Across Syria, a country that long prided itself on providing affordable food to its people, efforts to ensure basic sustenance appear to be failing, and millions are going hungry.

headline.main: Stick Figures and Stunted Growth as Warring Syria Goes Hungry
headline.print_headline: Stick Figures and Stunted Growth As Warring Syria Goes Hungry

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
